Key Match Events: Pakistan's Shadab Khan's all-round excellence helped keep Pakistan's slim T20 World Cup semi-final hopes alive
Iftikhar Ahmed was dropped on two but he contributed 51 off 35 balls before Shadab's onslaught of 52 from just 22 deliveries
Shadab had Temba Bavuma caught behind for 36 off 19 balls before castling Aiden Markram through the gate for 20 off 14 deliveries
Shaheen Shah Afridi snared Quinton de Kock then Rilee Rossouw, and finished with three for 14
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's prospects of the last four rest on them seeing off Bangladesh as well as relying on South Africa or India to lose
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method due to rain
Pakistan had beaten South Africa on all three previous meetings in the competition
